citations.narrative:
Three protocols were noted to contain exceptions to the standards of the Animal Welfare Act and Regulations that were
not specified or justified in the proposal to conduct the activity. Protocol A21019 involves Roborovskii hamsters being
housed in 5-inch-high cages instead of the required 6 inches. For protocols A22036 and A20029, nursing Syrian hamster
cages can be sanitized at an interval greater than the required 14 days in order to not disturb the animals around the time
of parturition. These exemptions were approved by the IACUC as general husbandry procedures for the given species but
not described/justified in the study protocols. Exceptions to the AWA regulations and standards can only be made and
approved by the IACUC when such exceptions are justified for the research study being conducted and specified in the
proposal to conduct the activity. To be corrected by September 14, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
